alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:30PM EST until January 30 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Hazleton. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Brief new flooding is expected along several rivers and streams with more widespread flooding ongoing elsewhere across central Indiana. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of lowland areas in progress in portions of Tippecanoe County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Sunday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1230 PM EST /1130 AM CST/.
